page.title: 13ATTITUDES
page.content: The Loch Centre is part of extensive redevelopment in TRANENT town centre. The first town centre redevelopment scheme,TRANENT CIVIC SQUARE was completed in 1972 and in 1975 the Secretary of State for Scotland approved the latest phase.The site housed a number of 'miners' rows' which were demolished in 1960.The swimming pool,built in 1970 is now incorporated in the centre.Facilities now offered are:-main hall with stage squash courts,a trampoline room, fitness room,cafeteria and catering kitchen,committee rooms,craft club and quiet rooms.Sheltered housing has been provided and is the first warden supervised scheme in Tranent.Situated next to the Health Centre it is an ideal location.Our survey showed this complex was approved of by all people interviewed and long over-due here.
